summary: To save money and improve health care quality, Medicare has been trying alternative payment models for reimbursing providers. Some models require providers to use electronic health records or to accept financial risk. That is, providers may receive rewards for meeting care quality goals, but payments could be reduced—or providers could owe money—for falling short. Fewer providers in rural or provider shortage areas participate in such...
title: Medicare: Information on the Transition to Alternative Payment Models by Providers in Rural, Health Professional Shortage, or Underserved Areas
